page.title: 13Denbigh Service Reservoir
page.content: Children at{Bryn Stanley}were intri- -gued by recent{excavations}next to their estate.A large notice proclaimed that work was being done for the{Welsh {Water Authority}by{Norwest Holst.}Our curiosity was satisfied during {Heulfre's}annual visit to camp school at{Pentrellyncymer}to pursue our {environmental studies.}Whilst touring the{Alwen Water works}to see the cleaning process for our water we learned of a{holding tank}being built at{Denbigh}to be fed by{Alwen water. Back home we visited the site to find out more. The sunken tank is{built of {reinforced concrete}with a{capacity {for 2500 cubic metres of water}to back up{Denbigh's}supply. Apart from a portion visible from higher ground nothing will be seen as the area will be{landscaped}with grass and trees to blend with the{environment.
